results.title: Underdog
results.creator_credit: Illumination Films (AU), Robert Colvin and Paul Cox
results.brief_description: The dingo is currently hunted as a pest in all states of Australia, and its survival as a pure breed is endangered. This documentary presents a case for the dingo’s protection. It looks at the history of the dingo, its relationship with Australian Aborigines, and at the current dingo erradication program. Interviews people who are involved with the conservation of dingoes, including people who keep them as pets. This is another early film from renowned Australian filmmaker, Paul Cox.

results.title: Undercurrents
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films, R A Films and Robin Lehman
results.brief_description: The sting-ray encompasses the undulent beauty and violent potential that characterise the underwater world. Undercurrents of the beauty and violence of life are carefully balanced.

results.title: Undercover
results.creator_credit: Palm Beach Pictures, Filmco, David Elfick and David Stevens
results.brief_description: Join in the singing, the flag-waving, the dancing, the scandal and the fights that made the roaring twenties such an exciting and memorable time for Australia. Undercover catches the glitter and madness of those times and follows one typical Australian whose imagination, drive and energy turned his impossible dream into reality. Stars Genevieve Picot.

results.title: Underbelly
results.brief_description: Underbelly explores the dark undercurrent of the city and the unconcious mind. Underbelly is the place between asleep and awake, where a shadow helps you navigate the quiet city streets.

results.title: Underage
results.creator_credit: Lemon Film, Lizzie Lemon and Kim Longinotto
results.brief_description: A look at a group of eight teenagers - all in the 15/16 age group - who live in Coventry. The film traces the pressures of growing up without real prospects of employment and it examines the teenagers’ need to prove their identity. Subjects discussed include, racism, glue-sniffing, petty theft and promiscuity.

results.title: Under western skies
results.brief_description: A survey of the dry farming and the irrigation farming practices carried out in the western states of USA furing the 1940’s. Criticism made towards farmers, ranchers and timber merchants for land abuse, soil degradation and water irrigation. Examples shown of conservation farming.

results.title: Under the weather = A L'ombre
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Yves Leduc, Pierre Heberrt and Tali
results.brief_description: A delightful animation without narration about a group of happy vacationers who are lounging on a beach enjoying a lazy afternoon, but under cloudy skies things soon take a disturbing turn. This was the first animation by Tali who won the contest Cineastes Recherches du Studio d’Animation du Programme Francais de l’ONF in 1994.

results.title: Under the volcano
results.creator_credit: Ithaca-Conacine, Moritz Borman, Wieland Schulz-Keil and John Huston
results.brief_description: Albert Finney and Jacqueline Bisset combine to bring Malcolm Lowry’s powerful, critically acclaimed novel to the screen with all its imagery, symbolism, insight and passion. A despairing alcoholic British ex-consul in a small Mexican town goes on a drunken odyssey on the local day of the dead. During the intense dramatic twenty four hours he is distracted but not really diverted from his downward descent into damnation. The vivid brutal action is shocking and the tragic self absorption haunting. Also stars Anthony Andrews.

results.title: Under the skin (E)
results.creator_credit: BFI, Channel 4 Films, Strange Dog Prod, Kate Ogburn and Carine Adler
results.brief_description: Samantha Morton is Iris, a young woman who is increasingly estranged from her happily married older sister, Rose (Claire Rushbrook). When their mother is diagnosed with a terminal disease Iris is thrown into such a turmoil of grief, anger and despair that she leaves her home, her job and her boyfriend and attempts to dull her pain by immersing herself into a frenzied abuse of alcohol, drugs and sex. As if countering her jealousy of Rose by becoming her exact opposite, Iris involves herself in casual sado-masochistic encounters that leave her both exhilarated and disturbed. “Under the Skin” won the Jury Prize at the Toronto Film Festival and the Michael Powell Award at the Edinburgh Film Festival. Carine Adler’s debut feature film dares to tackle the ambiguities and contradictions of female sexuality and female competition in a contemporary world were many of the challenges of second-wave feminism have become accepted and institutionalised. In allowing Iris to be boldly naked - physically, metaphysically, and emotionally - Samantha Morton creates an unique and stunning central character. Cast also includes Rita Tushingham as the mother.
